Docs.summary: Gets the encoding of the text in the original source document.
Docs.remarks: Depending on the method used to create a the encoding may be used to read the file contents, or it may be solely informational. Refer to the documentation on the method used to create the for details.

Docs.summary: Gets the file path of the orginal source document.
Docs.remarks: The file path may be either an absolute path or project-relative path. An absolute path is required to generate debuggable assemblies.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the algorithm used to compute the checksum returned by .
Docs.remarks: This member did not exist in the 2.0 release, so it is possible for an implementation to return the wrong value (or null). Implementations of should override this member and specify their choice of hash algorithm even if it is the same as the default (SHA1).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string RelativePath { get; }
.property instance string RelativePath
Public Overridable ReadOnly Property RelativePath As String
member this.RelativePath : string
public: virtual property System::String ^ RelativePath { System::String ^ get(); };
public: virtual property Platform::String ^ RelativePath { Platform::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the project-relative path to the source file. May be null.
Docs.remarks: The relative path (if provided) is used for display (error messages). The project-relative path may also be used to embed checksums of the original source documents to support runtime recompilation of Razor code.
